document: {"blocks":[{"key":"29qbf","text":"1. For whole-cell patch-clamp recordings, 3-4 mice of each genotype and condition were used for miniature excitatory postsynaptic current (mEPSC) and miniature inhibitory postsynaptic current (mIPSC) measurements. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqd4i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es41m","text":"2. WT and LRRK2 G2019Ski/ki mice of both sexes were anesthetized with 200 mg/kg tribromoethanol (avertin) and decapitated. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":6},{"style":"sup","offset":22,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgvm7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nle8","text":"3. After decapitation, the brains were immersed in ice-cold artificial cerebrospinal fluid (aCSF, in mM): 125 NaCl, 2.5 KCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1 mM CaCl2, 10 glucose, 25 NaHCO3, 1.25 NaHPO4, 0.4 L-ascorbic acid, and 2 Na-pyruvate, pH 7.3-7.4 (310 mOsmol). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":134,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":148,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":171,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":184,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afv6n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92jcb","text":"4. 350 μm thick coronal slices containing the ACC were obtained using a vibrating tissue slicer (Leica VT1200; Leica Biosystems). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"166n0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anaf","text":"5. Slices were immediately transferred to standard aCSF (33°C, continuously bubbled with 95% O2– 5% CO2) containing the same as the low-calcium aCSF but with 1 mM MgCl2and 1-2 mM CaCl2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":94,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":102,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":167,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":183,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2t3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fo0lb","text":"6. After 30-minute incubation at 33°C, slices were transferred to a holding chamber with the same extracellular buffer at room temperature (RT: ∼25°C). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c36n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u4u9","text":"7. Brain slices were visualized by an upright microscope (BX61WI, Olympus) through a 40× water-immersion objective equipped with infrared-differential interference contrast optics in combination with a digital camera (ODA-IR2000WCTRL). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qpbt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9sfc","text":"8. Patch-clamp recordings were performed by using an EPC 10 patch-clamp amplifier, controlled by Patchmaster Software (HEKA). Data were acquired at a sampling rate of 50 kHz and low-pass filtered at 6 kHz.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22pbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg688","text":"9. To measure mEPSCs, the internal solution contained the following (in mM): 125 K-gluconate, 10 NaCl, 10 HEPES, 0.2 EGTA, 4.5 MgATP, 0.3 NaGTP, and 10 Na-phosphocreatine, pH adjusted to 7.2 – 7.4 with KOH and osmolality set to ∼ 300 mOsmol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fa49","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0k3g","text":"10. mEPSCs were measured in the aCSF bath solution containing 1 µM tetrodotoxin and 50 µM Picrotoxin at -70 mV in voltage-clamp mode. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djeu4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ro81","text":"11. To measure mIPSCs, the internal solution contained the following (in mM): 77 K-gluconate, 77 KCl, 10 HEPES, 0.2 EGTA, 4.5 MgATP, 0.3 NaGTP, and 10 Na-phosphocreatine, pH adjusted to 7.2 – 7.4 with KOH and osmolality set to ∼ 300 mOsmol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqcj2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mupg","text":"12. mIPSCs were measured in the aCSF bath solution containing 1 µM tetrodotoxin and 10 µM 6-cyano-7-nitroquinoxaline-2,3-dione (CNQX), and 50 µM D-2-amino-5-phosphonopentanoate (D-AP5) at -70 mV in voltage-clamp mode. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"614su","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93j4e","text":"13. mEPSCs and mIPSCs recorded at -70 mV were detected using Minhee Analysis software (https://github.com/parkgilbong/Minhee_Analysis_Pack). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":87,"length":51}],"data":{}},{"key":"6btna","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3t63","text":"14. To analyze the frequency, events were counted over 5 minutes of recording. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qpng","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asqum","text":"15. To obtain the average events for each cell, at least 100 non-overlapping events were detected and averaged. The peak amplitude of the average mEPSCs was measured relative to the baseline current.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DADD387FF98811ED98410A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/parkgilbong/Minhee_Analysis_Pack"}}}}

title: Mouse brain slice electrophysiology
